context: The image shows a beautiful, dark horse with white markings running through a golden, sun-drenched meadow, creating a serene and majestic scene.

ChatGPT is used for a variety of tasks, including answering questions, generating text, and engaging in conversations.

This panoramic shot captures the cityscape of Beirut, Lebanon, stretching along the Mediterranean coastline with the iconic Mohammad Al-Amin Mosque (also known as the Gold Mosque) and the adjacent Marine Tower visible in the foreground.

This is a painting depicting the raising of Jesus Christ, with a radiant halo above his head, and a group of onlookers, presumably his disciples, gazing up at him in awe. The scene appears to be set on a hillside, likely Mount of Transfiguration.

The image depicts the iconic portrait "Mona Lisa" by Leonardo da Vinci, a Renaissance masterpiece renowned for its enigmatic smile and sfumato technique. It is currently housed in the Louvre Museum in Paris, France.

The image shows two stunning black horses, likely Appaloosas due to their spotted markings, standing in a grassy field under a cloudy blue sky. These horses are likely located in a region where Appaloosas are commonly found, such as the Western United States.

The image shows a series of three black and white photographs of a pregnant woman in profile, representing the progression of pregnancy from early stages to a more advanced state. The photographs are set against a muted cream background with a white circular pattern.

The image shows a French Dassault Rafale fighter jet soaring through the sky, likely during an airshow or military exercise. The Rafale is a multirole combat aircraft widely used by the French Air and Space Force.

This is Leonardo da Vinci’s iconic painting, “The Last Supper,” depicting the moment Jesus announces that one of his disciples will betray him. The scene is set in the refectory of the Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie in Milan, Italy, where it was originally painted.

The image shows a Penrose diagram. It is also known as a Penrose triangle or an impossible triangle. It is a visual illusion that creates a three-dimensional shape from two-dimensional lines, highlighting the tricks our perception plays on us.
The image shows the flag of Algeria, which features a vertical tricolor of black, white, and green, with a red star in the center. Algeria is a country located in North Africa.

Algeria is the largest country in Africa by land area, located in North Africa along the Mediterranean coast. Its capital is Algiers. Official languages are Arabic and Berber, and the currency is the Algerian dinar. Major industries include hydrocarbons (oil and natural gas), agriculture, and mining.

University of Algiers (founded 1909) is the oldest and most prestigious public university in Algeria, located in the capital, Algiers. It comprises multiple faculties including Law, Medicine, Sciences, Literature, and Social Sciences.
University of Oran 1 Ahmed Ben Bella (est. 1965) is a leading public university in the city of Oran. It offers programs in Engineering, Medicine, Humanities, and Economics across 20+ faculties.
University of Constantine 1 Salah-Bey (est. 1969) is located in Constantine and features faculties of Sciences, Technology, Medicine, and Letters with strong research in applied sciences.

Abou Bekr Belkaïd University of Tlemcen (founded 1978) is in Tlemcen and offers degrees in Science, Technology, Medicine, Law, and Business. It hosts research centers in renewable energy and environment.
Badji Mokhtar University of Annaba (est. 1975) is based in Annaba and includes faculties of Science, Technology, Medicine, Economics, and Arts, with notable marine sciences programs.
University of Blida 1 Saad Dahlab (founded 1981) in Blida specializes in Agricultural Sciences, Veterinary Medicine, Technology, and Natural Sciences, reflecting the region’s agrarian economy.
Mohand Akli Ould Khodar University of Béjaïa (est. 1983) is a public institution in Béjaïa with faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Humanities, serving the Kabylie region.
Ferhat Abbas University of Sétif 1 (founded 1978) is located in Sétif and comprises faculties of Engineering, Sciences, Medicine, and Humanities, with research strong in highland agriculture.
Mouloud Mammeri University of Tizi Ouzou (est. 1977) serves the Kabylie region from Tizi Ouzou, offering programs in Science, Technology, Arts, Law, and Social Sciences.
University of Jijel (founded 2009) is a newer public university in Jijel, featuring faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Letters, and focuses on coastal environmental studies.
University of Médéa (est. 2001) in Médéa consists of faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Medicine, with a growing focus on digital innovation.
University of Skikda (founded 2004) is a public institution in Skikda offering programs in Engineering, Science, Technology, Economics, and Humanities, and emphasizing petrochemical research.
University of Biskra (est. 2005) located in Biskra offers degrees in Science, Technology, Medicine, Economics, and Humanities, with special programs in desert agriculture.
University of El Oued (founded 2001) in El Oued offers faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Arts, focusing on Saharan studies and sustainable development.
University of Ghardaïa (est. 2001) in Ghardaïa provides programs in Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Humanities, with research in oasis ecosystem management.
University of Laghouat (founded 2001) is based in Laghouat and includes faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Humanities, emphasizing arid zone research.
University of Tébessa (est. 2001) in Tébessa offers programs in Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Medicine, with archaeological studies owing to the region’s Roman heritage.
University of Adrar (founded 2001) in Adrar comprises faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Humanities, focusing on desertification and renewable energy.
University of Bordj Bou Arréridj (est. 2001) is located in Bordj Bou Arréridj and offers faculties of Science, Technology, Economics, Law, and Letters, with research in industrial informatics.

The University of Science and Technology of Oran – Mohamed Boudiaf (USTO-MB) is a public research university located in Bir El Djir, Oran, Algeria. Established on September 1, 1986, it was designed by Japanese architect Kenzō Tange and later renamed to honor President Mohamed Boudiaf.

USTO-MB comprises seven faculties: Chemistry; Physics; Mathematics and Computer Science; Natural and Life Sciences; Architecture and Civil Engineering; Electrical Engineering; and Mechanical Engineering, along with an Institute of Physical Education and Sports.
The university offers a variety of programs: 24 specialties for bachelor's degrees, 48 for master's degrees, and 44 for postgraduate studies, including professional bachelor's and master's programs.
USTO-MB has over 26,000 students, including more than 500 international students from 22 countries, and employs over 900 lecturers.
The university follows the Bologna Process (LMD system) since 2004, offering License (Bachelor), Master, and Doctorate degrees.

USTO-MB is involved in national research initiatives through organizations like the National Commission for the Evaluation of University Research Projects (CNEPRU), the National Agency for the Development of University Research (ANDRU), and the National Agency for the Development of Health Research (ANDRS).
The Faculty of Medicine Moulay-Driss-Mansouri at USTO-MB trains future doctors, complementing the nearby Établissement hospitalier universitaire d'Oran (EHU Oran).
The university encourages student participation in scientific, cultural, and sports clubs, fostering a vibrant campus life.
USTO-MB's campus includes facilities like an athletics track, Olympic swimming pool, and football stadium, supporting its Institute of Physical Education and Sports.
The university offers intensive language courses in English, French, German, Korean, Turkish, and other languages to enhance students' linguistic skills.
USTO-MB has a dedicated Student Guide available in Arabic and French, providing comprehensive information about university procedures and student life.
The university's official website is https://www.univ-usto.dz/en/, offering resources and information for students, faculty, and visitors.
USTO-MB is ranked among the top public universities in Oran, Algeria, and was placed in the 171–180 range in the 2025 Arab Region Rankings.
The university's address is El Mnaouar, BP 1505, Bir El Djir 31000, Oran, Algeria. Contact phone: +213 41 62 71 81; Fax: +213 41 62 71 60.
USTO-MB has an active alumni network, with over 19,000 alumni on LinkedIn, reflecting its significant contribution to various professional fields.
The university collaborates with international institutions to promote research and academic exchange, enhancing its global engagement.
USTO-MB offers programs in Applied Sciences and Technology through its dedicated institute, focusing on practical and industry-relevant education.
The Faculty of Architecture and Civil Engineering at USTO-MB provides education and research opportunities in sustainable design and infrastructure development.
USTO-MB's Faculty of Electrical Engineering includes departments like Electronics, Electrical Engineering, and Automatics, contributing to advancements in technology.
The university's Faculty of Mechanical Engineering offers programs in Mechanical Engineering, Maritime Engineering, and Mining and Metallurgy, supporting Algeria's industrial sectors.
